metadata.title: CVE-2019-10092 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4.0-2.4.39, a limited cross-site scripting issue was reported affecting the mod_proxy error page. An attacker could cause the link on the error page to be malformed and instead point to a page of their choice. This would only be exploitable where a server was set up with proxying enabled but was misconfigured in such a way that the Proxy Error page was displayed.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-10092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-data - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> all 2.4.x up to 2.4.41 first two upstream patches are hardening

criterions.comment: apache2 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-1ubuntu1').
